meanings.definition: Opposite in position, direction, order, or effect.
meanings.sent1: The inverses sides of the magnet repelled each other.
meanings.sent2: The north and south poles are inverses to each other.
meanings.sent3: The inverses paths of the two cars led to a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful demeanor was the inverse of his gloomy outlook.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors were the inverse of the dull room.

meanings.definition: A relationship between two elements such that if one element is given, the other is uniquely determined.
meanings.sent1: In mathematics, finding inverses helps solve equations.
meanings.sent2: The inverse of addition is subtraction.
meanings.sent3: The inverse of the missing number was easily calculated.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the perfect inverse of their rivalry.
meanings.sent5: The key to the puzzle was hidden in the inverse relationship between the symbols.
